body:
<!--

- Refer to the [known issues](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/docs/KNOWNISSUES.md).
- Fill out the following repro template:

If it's not a bug, please remove the template and elaborate the issue in your own words.
-->

Steps to reproduce
------------------
1. Open Poweshell. 
2. Type `ping 8.8.8.8`, This is kind of necessary to show my problem. Any command that prints >1 line of output'll do just fine. 
3. Now, Type "some text, Doesn't matters what it is". So, Now your shell will look something like this. 
    
    `powershell C:> some text, Doesn't matters what it is`
4. Now press `Ctrl+L`(On Windows). 

Expected behavior
-----------------

It should clear the output printed by the `ping` command and move the prompt to the top of screen without deleting the text "some text, Doesn't matters what it is".  This is the behaviour shown by pretty much all shells on linux. 

Actual behavior
---------------

It just prints `^L` to console. Sometimes it does what I mentioned in the "Expected behaviour" section but most of the time it just prints `^L` in console which is quite annoying. 

I am a begninner in C# and if someone can give me some pointers on what's causing this problem I can try fixing it. 

Regards 
Ishan Jain

PS: 
I searched Github issues, Known Issues page with terms like "Clear screen", "Ctrl+L" and "^L" but didn't found anything relevant.
